intro: Astoma, commonly known as the "false hellebore," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright, often branched stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The leaves are typically alternate, simple, and have a rough or hairy texture. Astoma species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including Europe, Asia, and North America. They are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
